column1: 2 ^ Exsultáte Deo adjutóri nostro~; jubiláte Deo Jacóbis. ^ Rejoice to God our helper~; sing aloud to the God of Jacob.

column2: et date tìmpanum~; psaltérium jucùndum cum cìttara. ^ Take a psalm
column3: and bring hither the timbrel~; the pleasant psaltery with the harp.
^ Give sound with the trumpet on the new moon
column4: on the noted day of your solemnity

column2: et judìcium Deo Jacóbis. ^ for it is a commandment in Israel
column3: and a judgment to the God of Jacob.

column2: qŭum exíret de terra Aegìpti~; lingŭam qŭam non nóverat
column3: aŭdívit. ^ He ordained it for a testimony in Joseph
column4: when he came out of the land of Egypt~; a tongue which he knew not

column1: 7 ^ Divèrtit ab onèribus dorsum ejus~; manûs ejus in còfino servivérunt. ^ He removed his back from the burdens~; his hands had served in baskets.

column2: et liberávi te~; exaŭdívi te in abscòndito tempestátis~; probávi te apud aqŭam contradicțiónis. ^ Thou calledst upon me in affliction
column3: and I delivered thee~; I heard thee in the secret place of tempest~; I proved thee at the waters of contradiction.

column6: and I will testify to thee~; O Israel
column7: if thou wilt hearken to me.

column1: 10 ^ Non èrit in te deus rècens
column2: nèqŭe adorábis deum aliénum. ^ There shall be no new god in thee
column3: nor shalt thou adore a strange god.

column1: 11 ^ Ego ènim sum Dòminus Deus tuus
column2: qŭi edúxi te de terra Aegìpti~; diláta os tuum
column3: et implébo illud. ^ For I am the Lord thy God
column4: who brought thee out of the land of Egypt~; open thy mouth wide

column1: 12 ^ Et non aŭdívit pòpulus meus vocem meam
column2: et Isráhel non intèndit mìhi. ^ But my people heard not my voice
column3: and Israel hearkened not to me.

column1: 13 ^ Et dimísi eos secùndum desidèria cordis eórum~; ibunt in adinvențiónibus suîs. ^ So I let them go according to the desires of their heart~; they shall walk in their own inventions.

column2: Isráhel si in viîs meîs ambulavìsset
column3: ^ If my people had heard me
column4: if Israel had walked in my ways

column1: 15 ^ pro nìhilo fórsitan inimícos eórum humiliavìssem
column2: et super tribulántes eos misìssem manum meam. ^ I should soon have humbled their enemies
column3: and laid my hand on them that troubled them.

column2: et èrit tempus eórum in sáĕcula. ^ The enemies of the Lord have lied to him
column3: and their time shall be for ever.

column1: 17 ^ Et cibávit eos ex ádipe frumènti
column3: melle saturávit eos. ^ And he fed them with the fat of wheat
column4: and filled them with honey out of the rock.
